org.coniks.coniks_server

Class ServerUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.coniks.coniks_server.ServerUtils

  • public class ServerUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements various utility functions used by various components of a CONIKS server.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ServerUtils.PrefixComparator
      Comparator for ordering the pendingQueue in increasing order of a data binding lookup index's first 24 bits.

      • HASH_SIZE_BITS

        @Deprecated
public static final int HASH_SIZE_BITS
        Deprecated. Moved to Digest.
        The size of the Merkle tree hashes in bits. Current hashing algorithm: SHA-256
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HASH_SIZE_BYTES

public static final int HASH_SIZE_BYTES
        Deprecated. Moved to Digest.
        The size of the Merkle tree hashes in bytes. Current hashing algorithm: SHA-256
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SIG_SIZE_BYTES

        @Deprecated
public static final int SIG_SIZE_BYTES
        Deprecated. Moved to Signing.
        The size of the CONIKS server's STR signatures in bytes. Server signature scheme: RSAwithSHA256.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Deprecated. Moved to Logging.
        The maximum number of bytes logged per log file.

    • Method Detail

      • printStatusMsg

        @Deprecated
public static void printStatusMsg(boolean isErr,
                             java.lang.String msg)
        Deprecated. Replaced with private method in ConiksServer.
        Prints server status and error messages. Used primarily for testing mode.
        Parameters:
        isErr - indicates whether this is an error message
        msg - the status message to print

      • hash

        @Deprecated
public static byte[] hash(byte[] input)
        Deprecated. Replaced with Digest.digest(byte[])
        Generates the cryptographic hash of input. Current hashing algorithm: SHA-256.
        Returns:
        The hash as a byte[] or null in case of an error.

      • hashChildren

        public static byte[] hashChildren(byte[] left,
                  byte[] right)
        Generates the cryptographic hash of the left and right subtree hashes of a Merkle tree node. This is really just a wrapper around hash(byte[]).
        Returns:
        The hash as a byte[] or null in case of an error.

      • bytesToHex

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String bytesToHex(byte[] bytes)
        Deprecated. Moved to Convert.
        Converts a byte[] into a String of its hexadecimal representation.
        Returns:
        The hex representation of bytes as a String.

      • strToBytes

        @Deprecated
public static byte[] strToBytes(java.lang.String str)
        Deprecated. Moved to Convert.
        Converts a UTF-8 String str to an array of bytes.

      • unameToIndex

        public static byte[] unameToIndex(java.lang.String uname)
        Converts a username to a CONIKS lookup index using a verifiable unpredicctable function (VUF). Current VUF algorithm: SHA-256.
        Returns:
        The byte[] representation of the lookup index.

      • longToBytes

        @Deprecated
public static byte[] longToBytes(long val)
        Deprecated. Moved to Convert.
        Converts a long val into an array of bytes.
        Returns:
        The byte[] representation of the long value.

      • getNthBit

        @Deprecated
public static boolean getNthBit(byte[] arr,
                           int offset)
        Deprecated. Moved to Convert.
        Finds the byte in the byte array arr at offset offset, and determines whether it is 1 or 0.
        Returns:
        true if the nth bit is 1, false otherwise.

      • getPrefixBytes

        @Deprecated
public static byte[] getPrefixBytes(byte[] arr)
        Deprecated. Moved to Convert.
        Gets the 16-bit prefix of a byte array arr.
        Returns:
        the first 16 bits of arr or all zeros if the length of the array is less than 2 bytes.

      • compareByteBuffers

        @Deprecated
public static boolean compareByteBuffers(byte[] buf1,
                                    byte[] buf2)
        Deprecated. Use Arrays.equals(byte[], byte[])
        Compares two byte buffers for byte-by-byte equality.
        Returns:
        true if the buffers are identical, false otherwise.

      • convertRSAPubKey

        public static byte[] convertRSAPubKey(java.security.interfaces.RSAPublicKey pub)
        Converts an RSAPublicKey pub to a hashable array of bytes. This function is currently unused.
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized RSAPublicKey.

      • convertDSAPubKey

        public static byte[] convertDSAPubKey(java.security.interfaces.DSAPublicKey pub)
        Converts an DSAPublicKey pub to a hashable array of bytes. This function is currently unused.
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized DSAPublicKey.

      • getUserLeafNodeBytes

        public static byte[] getUserLeafNodeBytes(UserLeafNode uln)
        Converts a UserLeafNode uln to a hashable array of bytes.
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized UserLeafNode.

      • getInteriorNodeBytes

        public static byte[] getInteriorNodeBytes(InteriorNode in)
        Converts a InteriorNode in to a hashable array of bytes.
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized InteriorNode.

      • getRootNodeBytes

        public static byte[] getRootNodeBytes(RootNode rn)
        Converts a RootNode rn to a hashable array of bytes.
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized RootNode.

      • getSTRBytesForSig

        public static byte[] getSTRBytesForSig(RootNode rn,
                       long ep,
                       long prevEp,
                       byte[] prevStrHash)
        Takes the components of a signed tree root: root node, current epoch, previous epoch, hash of previous STR, and serializes them into a byte[] that can be used to generate the STR's digital signature.
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized STR components.

      • getSTRBytes

        public static byte[] getSTRBytes(SignedTreeRoot str)
        Converts a SignedTreeRoot str to a hashable array of bytes
        Returns:
        The byte[] containing the serialized STR components.
